importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The article was updated on this date to report the rollout of Coca-Cola's cane sugar soda in the U.S., following earlier discussions and promises from President Trump.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The soda began rolling out in July 2025, following a public commitment by President Trump, and the rollout continues into October 2025.

keyTakeAways: Coca-Cola has begun selling a soda made with cane sugar instead of high-fructose corn syrup in the United States, in response to a demand from President Donald Trump.
The shift follows Trump’s advocacy against high-fructose corn syrup, particularly through his Health and Human Services secretary, Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
The new cane sugar soda is being rolled out to 'select' cities and retailers, not nationwide.
Coca-Cola already uses cane sugar in other products such as Simply lemonade, Gold Peak iced tea, and Costa canned coffee in the U.S.
Cane sugar is used in some international versions of Coke, including in Mexico.
Health experts have noted that sugary sodas — whether made with cane sugar or corn syrup — are not healthy.
This development coincides with Coca-Cola's broader success in healthier drink offerings, including the growth of Coca-Cola Zero Sugar (up 14% globally) and the relaunch of BodyArmor and Smartwater.
Coca-Cola's stock rose more than 3% in early trading after the announcement.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Coca-Cola has launched a new cola variant in the United States using cane sugar instead of high-fructose corn syrup, following a demand from former President Donald Trump. This move aligns with the advocacy of Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. against corn syrup. The product is being rolled out to select cities and retailers, with the company already using cane sugar in other beverages like Simply lemonade and Gold Peak iced tea. Despite the switch, health experts note that sugary sodas remain unhealthy, regardless of sweetener type. The development comes alongside Coca-Cola’s growing success in healthier drink offerings, such as the 14% global increase in Coca-Cola Zero Sugar sales and the relaunch of BodyArmor and Smartwater, which has positively impacted stock performance.
title: Coca-Cola’s Trump-approved soda begins to roll out in the United States
